page.title: 07Features of Old St.Leonard's
page.content: Of historical interest are a number of James Burton's early developments. Facing the sea is Burton's original Regency home,Crown House,where the Princess Victoria once stayed and to the East the impressive Royal Victoria Hotel behind which lies the Assembly Hall.To the rear,approached through the archway of South Lodge,are St.Leonard's Gardens.Originally a subscription garden it is now open to the public,providing an area of peace and tranquillity.Along the Gardens' eastern perimeter path lies a border of aromatic plants,each having a Braille nameplate for the benefit of the blind.Leaving the Gardens through the archway of North Lodge you come to the later residential area of St.Leonard's with its fine range of stone built Victorian houses and cottages which include Clock House.
